sentence.Network_en: The canoe is made from an impermeable wood.
sentence.Network_cn: 独木舟由防水木头制成。

sentence.Network_en: The external layer of the skin is relatively impermeable to water.
Thus clays and shales tend to be impermeable.
sentence.Network_cn: 因此粘土和页岩就往往不透水.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from French imperméable, or from late Latin impermeabilis, from in- 'not' + permeabilis (see permeable)

entry.tran: 不容液体透过的;防水(或液体)的
entry.def: Something that is impermeable will not allow fluid to pass through it.

example.ex: The canoe is made from an impermeable wood.
example.tran: 独木舟由防水木头制成。

means.word_mean: 1. preventing especially liquids to pass or diffuse through;

auth_sentence.content: Outside, there was only the desert huge, an impermeable membrane.
